title: Craig Damrauer
content: Advertising = Hey You + Buy Something

title: Ricardo Zea
content: Learning Web Design is like playing video games: You start small and build your character as you progress, then you beat the boss, literally.

title: Ron Miriello
content: We’re all naturally curious when we’re eight years old. But as most people get older, they become less and less curious, so they ask other people to be curious for them. That’s what I do for a living.

title: Carlo Angelini
content: Leafing through an old magazine, I noticed a small ad about a design course by mail. The headline read, “Art for pleasure and profit!” I have never found a better definition to describe my profession. Of course, at times it is more the pleasure and less the profit, at times the contrary. But if one of the components were missing, design wouldn’t exist.

title: D.H. Lawrence
content: Design in art, is a recognition of the relation between various things, various elements in the creative flux. You can’t invent a design. You recognize it, in the fourth dimension. That is, with your blood and your bones, as well as with your eyes.

title: Nick Law
content: Creativity is a habit. It’s not something that happens in the shower.

title: Gemma O’Brien
content: The great thing about personal work is that it can shape your commercial work. Clients see what you create for yourself and that can be the starting point for a new project, which closes the cap between the work you love making and the work you get paid for.

title: Andrew Hunt
content: The ability to change on a dime is one thing small teams have by default that big teams can never have. This is where the big guys envy the little guys. What might take a big team in a huge organization weeks to change may only take a day in a small, lean organization. That advantage is priceless.

title: Joshua Blankenship
content: But the web will still be full of arrogant, uninformed, polarizing, self-promoting, controversy-creating content that has ramifications no one wants to own up to. And consequently, the web will still be lacking in common courtesy, humility, and the admittance that most of us don’t know best. Which is sad, mostly because it’s true.

title: David A. Stuebe
content: Brand identity is too often limited to personal style.

title: Steven Snell
content: Whenever I have an idea I write it down, even if it’s not a very good idea. Sometimes the bad ideas will lead to better ones.

title: John Tanedo
content: Design to express, not to impress.

title: Mahatma Gandhi
content:
A customer is the most important visitor on our premises.
He is not dependent on us. We are dependent on him.
He is not an interruption of our work. He is the purpose of it.
He is not an outsider to our business. He is part of it.
We are not doing him a favour by serving him.
He is doing us a favour by giving us the opportunity to do so.

title: Michael Cina
content: What’s the hardest thing to communicate? The hardest thing is to communicate.

title: Steven Heller
content: As a profession, graphic designers have been shamefully remiss or ineffective about plying their craft for social or political betterment.

title: Woody Allen
content: The best an idea gets is when it’s in your head.

title: Philip Glass
content: You get up early in the morning and you work all day. That’s the only secret.

title: Shel Silverstein
content:
When the light turns green, you go.
When the light turns red, you stop.
But what do you do when the light turns blue with orange and lavender spots?

title: Whitney Hess
content: “It looks good” is the worst feedback you can get.

title: Suleiman Leadbitter
content: Design trends online change more often than the wind, and slightly less often than my socks.

title: Marc Chagall
content: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.

title: Jonathan Snook
content: When you’re passionate about what you do, you become an evangelist for the very thing you do.

title: Erik Spiekermann
content: You are what you are seen to be.

title: Robert L. Peters
content: Design is the application of intent – the opposite of happenstance, and an antidote to accident.

title: Arman Nobari
content: Design is more of a kitchen than a knife, and more of a lab than a beaker.

title: Hristo Panayotov
content: Best thing about creating something is that it starts living it’s own life.

title: Mark Gobé
content: We live in a society where everybody feels guilty. We want to do good, but we don’t want to get out of the house. A brand can help us feel good if you buy this yogurt.

title: Bob Ross
content: Talent is a pursued interest. In other words, anything you are willing to practice, you can do.

title: Andy Warhol
content: You can be watching TV and see Coca-Cola, and you know that the President drinks Coke, Liz Taylor drinks Coke, and just think, you can drink Coke, too. A Coke is a Coke and no amount of money can get you a better Coke than the one the bum on the corner is drinking. All the Cokes are the same and all the Cokes are good. Liz Taylor knows it, the President knows it, the bum knows it, and you know it.

title: Ferdinand A. Porsche
content: Design must be functional and functionality must be translated into visual aesthetics, without any reliance on gimmicks that have to be explained.

title: Leonard Bernstein
content: To achieve great things, two things are needed: a plan, and not quite enough time.

title: Michael Stinson
content: Letterspacing creates speedbumps for the reader.

title: Sabo Tercero
content: We are all designers, the difference is that only a few of us do it full-time.

title: Alex King
content: Experience has shown that our best customers are ones who have as much respect for our time as we have for theirs.

title: Shane Meendering
content: Bad design shouts at you. Good design is the silent seller.
